fields.headline: Pollock ends on 99
fields.bodyText: The South Africa captain Shaun Pollock was left stranded on 99 as his side were bowled out for 448 on the fourth day of the second Test against the Sri Lankans at Centurion. Some patient batting from Makhaya Ntini had helped Pollock from 78 before the tailender slogged Chaminda Vaas straight into the hands of mid-off. Sri Lanka reached 180 for three in their second innings to lead by 55 runs when bad light stopped play 28 overs before the scheduled close. Zimbabwe were left staring defeat in the face at the close of the third day of the second Test against Pakistan in Bulawayo. They need 54 more runs with only five wickets left to make Pakistan bat for a second time. Zimbabwe, 225 runs behind on the first innings, lost all their top batsmen except Andy Flower in trying to save the match. Pakistan won the first Test in Harare by 119 runs and today should wrap up their second victory inside four days. West Indies beat India by five wickets in the fifth one-day international in Baroda. Wavell Hinds, with 80, and Chris Gayle, 101, smashed 132 runs in only 16.2 overs as the visitors successfully chased India's 290 for eight off 48 overs to take a 3-2 lead in the seven-match series.
